data.title: Federal Parliamentary Constitutional Monarchy - Vocab, Definition, and Must Know Facts
data.meta_description: A federal parliamentary constitutional monarchy is a form of governance where political power is divided between a central government and regional governments, with a monarch as the head of state. The monarch's role is usually ceremonial, and the country has a constitution that outlines the powers and limitations of each branch of government.
data.text:
Definition

A federal parliamentary constitutional monarchy is a form of governance where political power is divided between a central government and regional governments, with a monarch as the head of state. The monarch's role is usually ceremonial, and the country has a constitution that outlines the powers and limitations of each branch of government.
